comments:

Victor, the Package Explorer does not use the DeferredTreeContentManager, so this exception must come from another tree viewer.

From the stacktrace you posted, I cannot find out which other view is the culprit. Do you have more log entries or can you tell what other views are open when this happens? Also, which "cursor keys" do you press exactly (up, down, left, right, multiple at once)?

I tried to reproduce it yesterday and couldn't. I tried now after cleaning up my error log and have two errors. Before the errors occur the JDT seems to collect the errors from the projects I am skipping over.
I used the up and down keys.

I am using these views:
 - Editor (active)
 - Package explorer (active)
 - Error log (active)
 - Hierarchy
 - JUnit
 - Problems
 - Call Hierarchy
 - Console (no apps were running)
 - Search

When the error occurs I get an non-modal window with the title "Adding children" and text "Error".

These are the entries in the (cleaned up) error log:

On closer look, this is actually an SWT problem:
TreeItem (Tree parent, int style, int index) does not constrain the allowed range of the index, but still throws an "Index out of bounds" IAE.

Marking as dup of bug 121483.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 121483 ***
